module.p: Màiri Mary is a feminine anthroponymic proper noun.

section.p:
The principal parts of Màiri are –
Màiri – nominative/dative/genitive (singular)
A Mhàiri! – vocative
Like all proper nouns, Màiri can be modified by an attributive adjective.

Some examples –
Tha Màiri bheag bàn.
Little Mary is fair-haired. td. 9
Tha Calum mór agus Màiri bheag ag obair gu trang anns an achadh an diugh.
Big Malcolm and little Mary are working busily in the field today. td. 9
Tha Màiri bheag sgìth.
Little Mary is tired. td. 9
Tha Màiri bhàn anns an achadh an diugh agus tha i ag obair gu trang.
Fair-headed Mary is in the field today and she is working busily. td. 9

Examples with bi be –
Tha Màiri beag.
Mary is small. td. 6
Tha Màiri ag obair.
Mary is working. td. 6
Tha Màiri beag bàn.
Mary is small and fair-haired. td. 8
Tha Màiri bhàn anns an achadh an diugh agus tha i ag obair gu trang.
Fair-headed Mary is in the field today and she is working busily. td. 9

In a conjoined subject with agus and –
Tha Màiri agus Calum ag obair anns an achadh an diugh.
Mary and Malcolm are working in the field today. td. 6–7
Tha Calum mór agus Màiri bheag ag obair gu trang anns an achadh an diugh.
Big Malcolm and little Mary are working busily in the field today. td. 9
Màiri can be used as the complement of a preposition.

Some examples –
Tha falt dubh air Calum ach tha falt bàn air Màiri.
Calum has black hair but Mary has fair hair. td. 9
